definition[0]: to spoil or ruin something, especially something important or something that has been carefully planned
example[0]: It took me ages to get this right – I don’t want some idiot to mess it up.
example[1]: She felt she’d messed up her whole life.
definition[1]: to make something dirty or untidy
definition[2]: to make a mistake and do something badly
example[3]: I think I messed up on the last question.
example[4]: It doesn’t matter if you mess it up, you can always try again.
definition[3]: to make someone have emotional or mental problems
definition[4]: to hurt someone especially by hitting them
